name: Governor Tom Wolf

name: Governor Tom Wolf
tweet: This week‚Äôs early warning dashboard shows that all 67 counties have substantial COVID transmission.  For the next three weeks, I‚Äôm asking Pennsylvanians to stand united against COVID.  Together we can turn the tide of this surge and save lives. But we have to do it together.

name: Governor Tom Wolf
tweet: Extending my deepest gratitude for all of the well wishes sent to Frances and me.  We appreciate the prayers and support of Pennsylvanians and count ourselves lucky that my course of the virus was asymptomatic.

name: Governor Tom Wolf
tweet: We must unite to keep our hospitals and health care workers from becoming overwhelmed, and help Pennsylvanians get through the holiday season ‚Äî and closer to a COVID vaccine ‚Äî as safely as possible.  Together we can flatten the curve.

name: Governor Tom Wolf
tweet: COVID thrives where people gather together.  The measures announced today will target high-risk environments and aim to slow the devastating spread of the virus.

name: Governor Tom Wolf
tweet: Professional and collegiate sports may continue in accordance with guidance from @CDCgov and @PAHealthDept.  Spectators may not attend these events in person.

name: Governor Tom Wolf
tweet: We‚Äôre pausing sports for K-12 students.  In-person, extracurricular school activities are suspended but may be held virtually.

name: Governor Tom Wolf
tweet: Indoor operations at gyms and fitness facilities will be suspended.  In-person, indoor businesses in the entertainment industry that serve the public will close.  This includes casinos, movie theaters, museums, bowling alleys, and more.

name: Governor Tom Wolf
tweet: Outdoor gatherings and events of more than 50 people are also prohibited.  In-person businesses that serve the public  will be able to operate at 50% of maximum capacity ‚Äî except as limited by existing orders to a smaller capacity limit.

name: Governor Tom Wolf
tweet: Starting Saturday, indoor dining will be suspended. Outdoor dining, take-out food service, and take-out alcohol sales may continue.  Indoor gatherings and events of more than 10 people are prohibited.

name: Governor Tom Wolf
tweet: It has become clear that we need to take further action to protect Pennsylvanians and stop the spread of COVID.  Today I‚Äôm announcing additional, temporary mitigation measures that will go into effect Saturday and remain in place until 8 a.m. on January 4.  https://t.co/QyO4GgkWUD

name: Governor Tom Wolf
tweet: Happy to share Frances has tested negative for COVID.  Thank you for the well-wishes and support we have received.

name: Governor Tom Wolf
tweet: Pennsylvania‚Äôs health care professionals are working tirelessly to save lives during the COVID-19 pandemic.    The best thing we can do to thank them is take steps to help slow the spread and lift some of the burden off their shoulders.

name: Governor Tom Wolf
tweet: I ask all Pennsylvanians to wear a mask, stay home as much as possible, socially distance yourself from those not in your household, and, most of all, take care of each other and stay safe.

name: Governor Tom Wolf
tweet: As this virus rages, my positive test is a reminder that no one is immune from COVID.  Following all precautions as I have done is not a guarantee, but it is what we know to be vital to stopping the spread of the disease.

name: Governor Tom Wolf
tweet: I am continuing to serve the commonwealth and performing all of my duties remotely, as many are doing during the pandemic.

name: Governor Tom Wolf
tweet: During a routine test yesterday, I tested positive for COVID-19.  I have no symptoms and am feeling well and I am in isolation at home.  I am following CDC and Department of Health guidelines. Frances has been tested and, as we await the result, is quarantining at home with me.

tweet: Time to move on.

name: Governor Tom Wolf
tweet: We can prevent our hospitals from being stretched to the breaking point, but it means all of us need to take this virus seriously.  Please do what you can to slow the spread: Stay home as much as possible, wear a mask, and avoid gatherings.

name: Governor Tom Wolf
tweet: Here's what overwhelmed hospitals could mean:  If you or a loved one need care for a heart attack or other unexpected emergency, it could take much longer for emergency response personnel to get to you.  And once they do, you could be turned away from the hospital closest to you.

name: Governor Tom Wolf
tweet: Hospitalizations are reaching critical levels in Pennsylvania because of COVID.  Overwhelmed hospitals would be dangerous for everyone ‚Äî people who need care for COVID and for any other medical emergency.  https://t.co/qVlmytM9P3

name: Governor Tom Wolf
tweet: Doctors and nurses are frightened. And they're asking the public for help to stop the spread of COVID.  We can't continue to take our medical workers for granted.  They've been doing everything in their power to protect us from COVID.  And we need to do the same for them.

name: Governor Tom Wolf
tweet: We all need to take a hard look at our choices and take every precaution to protect our neighbors, families, and friends.  Please, stay home unless you need to go out.  Don‚Äôt attend gatherings with people outside your household.  And if you need to leave home, wear a mask.

name: Governor Tom Wolf
tweet: What happens if there are no more hospital beds? No more ventilators available?  Hospitals will be forced to turn people way. More Pennsylvanians will die.  Pennsylvanians who would not have died if they had been able to get the care they need and deserve.  This is unacceptable.

name: Governor Tom Wolf
tweet: Overwhelmed hospitals are dangerous for everyone ‚Äî those who need care for COVID and for any other emergency.  It becomes increasingly likely that resources and staff will be stretched to the breaking point with every day that COVID continues to spread in Pennsylvania.

name: Governor Tom Wolf
tweet: If you didn‚Äôt know before how urgent the situation is, please pay attention now.  The number of COVID cases in Pennsylvania over the course of the entire pandemic has topped 400,000.  Just six weeks ago that number was 200,000.  Hospitals are crowded and resources are dwindling.

name: Governor Tom Wolf
tweet: Today I‚Äôm with @PAHealthDept to sound the alarm that COVID cases in Pennsylvania have reached critical levels.  If we don‚Äôt slow the spread of this dangerous virus now, the reality is that COVID-19 will overwhelm our hospitals and our health care workers.  https://t.co/cDrYV5gjcX
